author: Mervin Lazaro
title: ðð¨ð°ðžð«ð¢ð§ð  ðš ð’ð®ð¬ð­ðšð¢ð§ðšð›ð¥ðž ð…ð®ð­ð®ð«ðž: ðð€ððŽð‚ðŽð‘ ðœð¡ðšð«ð­ð¬ ðŸð®ð­ð®ð«ðž ð¢ð§ ðš ð­ð¡ð«ðžðž-ððšð² ð¬ð­ð«ðšð­ðžð ð¢ðœ ð«ð¨ðšðð¦ðšð©ð©ð¢ð§ð  ð¬ð®ð¦ð¦ð¢ð­
text:
Let us be objectives-focused, solutions-finding and practical, urged [NAPOCOR President and CEO Koko Nograles during the Corporationâ€™s three-day strategic planning with leaders and managers as the group shapes the National Power Corporationâ€™s long-term direction.]
Facilitated by University of the Philippines professors, Oliva Domingo (DPA) and Reginald Ugaddan (PH.D), the workshop featured core session streams like Strategic Foresight and Futures Thinking, Sense-Making and Identifying Future Drivers, Developing Plausible Scenarios, and Crafting Foresight-Informed Strategic Priorities and a Roadmap. These sessions allowed participants to bank on their expertise and experiences to identify challenges, explore future energy landscapes and align corporate strategies.
One of the highlights of the workshop was the fireside chat with President Koko which allowed managers to ask question or gain insights into his perspectives on pressing organizational issues and the direction he envisions for NAPOCOR. The exchange fostered transparency and encouraged managers to reflect on their own roles for the Corporation and to see ways on how to better work together.
On the final day, participants took part in the Signing of the Commitment Charter, affirming their dedication to advancing NAPOCORâ€™S strategic roadmap and contributing to the corporationâ€™s mission of reliable, sustainable, and future-ready power development.
By the end of the workshop, NAPOCORâ€™S leaders emerged with a clearer view of the future they aim to build, one shaped by foresight, grounded in collaboration, and committed to powering a sustainable tomorrow for communities nationwide. #
